intro: Centaurea cyanus, commonly known as the common cornflower, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers, which are typically arranged in a circular pattern on a single stem. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Centaurea cyanus is also cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
